ratings.question_text: What is your overall assessment of this course?
What is your overall rating of the primary instructor?

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Great class. Great work at a group.
design thinking process!
Patience is virtue in design thinking
Design thinking process
Design thinking framework and how to use it.
Real-time application of design thinking to a real and meaningful/relevant issue: addressing workforce challenges.
How to approach public health issues, problems, and solutions in an organized and effective manner.

I learned about the design thinking process (from taking notice to building empathy, defining, ideating, designing and testing/prototyping. I learned about tools that could be used i.e., user personas, storyboarding.
Design thinking, working with consultants
I learned about Design Thinking frameworks

I learned about the process of design thinking, including how to focus on a human centered approach, brainstorm ideas, prototype and put an idea into action. I also learned how to work productively with a group.

Ability and need to think outside of the box in a creative manner. 
Focusing on the problem rather than solution seems to be a better approach.
Design thinking
I learned about the process of design thinking from its historical foundations to how it can be applied in current public health areas.

Building meaningful relationships within our group was very helpful as far as foundation. Implementation came later. The publications before we started the course were helpful. I felt Kali and the other instructors challenged us throughout the course.

I had a cursory knowledge of design thinking and really appreciated learning more about it. The real-world exercise gave me a strong sense of how to conduct this type of research on my own going forward.

I learned what Design Thinking is.  I learned how Design Thinking can reveal what we don't know, how we have misidentified "problems", and can be overly attached to our own solutions (particularly, solutions to problems that are misidentified problems).  I learned about the importance of psychological safety, emotional maturity, and diverse group of perspectives within groups.
I feel more capable of using design based thinking for complex problems.
I learned how do develop an idea based off of constituents.

narratives.question_text: What actions did you take that helped your learning in this course?
comments: I was very involved.
all classes and team project
Pre intensive course work.  Collaboration with group members and the instructor
Team work that utilized tools like Miro and Canva
Complete all assignments
Chose a strong group that worked well as a unit and kept up energy to contribute meaningfully throughout.
Attempted to actively implement and utilize the knowledge obtained

- Read all the assign reading materials 
- Studied/ did secondary research on the selected topic 
- Watched lectures and additional materials on the concepts
Reading some of the articles beforehand
Lots of exchanges with students
I completed all readings and assignments. I attended all lectures and was involved in group work.
Teamwork, communication, vulnerability
I attended live sessions
I tried to look at other resources that included those in my area which is not healthcare.
I did the work - the reading - and gave it my all.
I was fortunate that we formed a strong group with diverse people. Everyone in my group fully embraced the process which made a huge difference.

I read everything, I attempted my very best at assignments, I tried very hard to reflect on my own implicit biases and accept my experiences/views as one perspective of many, and I changed course radically when I could not contribute meaningfully to my group and continue to learn in a healthy way.  I communicated widely about this decision--to my former group, new group, and instructors.  At times, this felt like a humiliating experience, but I really think I grew as a student and human being.
Active participation in the course.
actively participated
